feed.title: Event
feed.subtitle: All items in Space Schedule > Event.

entry.title: Soyuz MS-20 Docking
entry.content: The Soyuz MS-20 spacecraft will dock to the International Space Station carrying ROSCOSMOS cosmonaut Alexander Misurkin as well as Japanese entrepreneur Yusaku Maezawa and his cameraman Yozo Hirano.

entry.title: US EVA-78
entry.content: NASA astronauts Thomas Marshburn and Kayla Barron will venture outside the orbiting outpost to replace the port 1 truss S-Band communications antenna.

entry.title: NG-16 Cygnus Release & Reentry
entry.content: The Northrop Grumman NG-16 Cygnus will be unberthed from the ISS before initiating a destructive reentry into the Earth's atmosphere taking waste along with it.

entry.title: Progress-M-UM & Prichal Docking
entry.content: The modified Progress space tug called Progress-M-UM will dock the Prichal node module to the nadir port of the MLM Nauka module on the International Space Station. It will provide four ports to mount additional modules and one docking port for cargo and crew spacecrafts.

entry.title: Solar Orbiter Earth Flyby
entry.content: Solar Orbiter, a partnership between ESA and NASA, will perform a gravity assist maneuver with Earth on November 26. Throughout its mission it also makes repeated gravity assist flybys of Venus to get closer to the Sun, and to change its orbital inclination, boosting it out of the ecliptic plane, to get the best – and first – views of the Sun’s poles.

entry.title: Progress MS-17 Undocking
entry.content:
The Progress MS-17 spacecraft will undock from the Nauka module of the International Space Station.
It will then de-orbit and burn up in the atmosphere.

entry.title: Crew-3 Crew Dragon Relocation
entry.content: NASA astronauts Raja Chari, Thomas Marshburn and Kayla Barron as well as ESA astronaut Matthias Maurer will relocate the Crew Dragon spacecraft to IDA-3 located at the zenith port of the Harmony module.

entry.title: SpaceX Crew-3 Crew Dragon Docking
entry.content: The Crew-3 Crew Dragon will dock autonomously to the International Space Station, carrying NASA astronauts Raja Chari, Thomas Marshburn and Kayla Barron as well as ESA astronaut Matthias Maurer to the International Space Station as crew members of Expedition 66.

entry.title: Starship S20 Static Fire #3
entry.content: SpaceX will likely conduct Starship S20 testing between 10am and 6pm local time, November 10.
